rComments: Loved him for Psyc 2 and 181. I learned a lot from him, and now i love stats.  he's very approachable, especially when i emailed him q's on hw's, he'd always answered back quickly. Just like any class, don’t study alone, go to your TA’s or his office hours, trust me it works! I agree if your gonna take stats take it with jack!

I would agree that Vevea is smart and "knows his stuff"; unfortunately, he doesn't know how to teach the stuff. Instead, he relies on the few students in class who can decipher the material to make it comprehensible to the rest of us. I agree that the material itself isn't hard per se, but is disjointed and incohesive in the way it's presented.

Jack is an amazing professor! He is very helpful and understanding. His office is always open and he is always willing to help. The class is very hard due to the material but Jack makes it fun by using real world examples. Those who bash Jack are just complaining because the class is very hard. If you study and go to every class you will be fine.

He's concerned only with students who happen to excel in math/stats; could care less about students who struggle with this. If all he cares about is bright math students, then why isn't he at a school like Cal or Stanford where the really bright students are? Um, HELLO..this is UCSC. It's like nurturing only the best students in a special ed class.

Let's face up..Vevea is NOT a good instructor. He's impatient and mean with students who aren't math wizzes, even though he talks a good game about being available to help (yeah, right). If you want to do well in 181, you had better have tight connections with a smart study group; otherwise you are completely on your own without even a textbook.

Jack was a very helpful teacher; in class, and in office hours.  When the midterm scores were less than adequate he made a deal and gave us our best score for one previous test.  His tests were not so bad, but we got to use notes and books so we could do well.  Overall, if you;re going to be taking psych 2, take it with Jack

He is absolutely wonderful! Very helpful and wants all his students to do well.  He makes everything very simple.  One of the best professors I've had so far.  Grading was more than fair...I can't find a reason why anyone would dislike him!
Application of abstract concepts to the REAL world, and teaching students how to use what they're learning in actual situations is one of Jack Vevea's biggest strengths.

I hate people who think everything should be handed to them on a silver platter. Admittedly, Jack's tough. The subject matter is tough. But if you work hard and utilize the numerous available resources, you'll do well. Because the class isn't mandatory, don't expect to blow it off.

I am terrible with math and was terrified of taking this class, but I ended up getting an A. Make sure to go to all lectures and keep up with the homework and you will do fine. He tries his best to make a boring subject interesting by coming up with engaging examples and experiments.

he is very smart and knows his stuff but can't communicate it well. couldn't follow a single thing. had him his first quarter teaching undergrads and he was too advanced for us. never did an assessment to see where we were at. wouldn't stop to answer quest
Really knows his stuff, and is very honest about what you need to know for the real world and what you don't. Very helpful to students who have difficulty with concepts.
Jack is the best.  The class is hard and you have to do your work, but if you pay attention in lecture and aren't afraid to ask him for help you'll do fine.  He's also got a good sense of humor.

Jack's class is extremely hard.  No one wants to take this class.  For us, it was 33% each for hwk, mid-term, final.  Do extra credit if he offers it.  Take a lot of notes in lecture and pay attention to SAS output-that is what the labs/exams are: interpreting SAS output!

Jack is the best math instructor I have ever had, and I HATE math because I am horrible at it.  If you have to take Psych 2, wait it out until you can take it with Jack.  You'll be glad you did. (Having a good TA in this class also helps GREATLY).

a very entertaining lecturer, helps if you have a good section leader, otherwise you may be screwed or have to read.  i hate math, i never read, i had an awesome section in which i paid really good attention and got a B.

Tough class! Used SAS which is like learning a programming language. Went over the heads of the class often because he knew the info so well. Easy to contact and anwsers all questions throughly. This man know stats!
I thought I would hate stats but this guy made it all make sense.

I felt Jack did a great job teaching the class. Exams were open-book/open-note and he gave many good examples in class, just take notes. Even if you don't take notes you'll likely do decent in the class.

Jack is an excellent math teacher. He is very helpful. Its true that the class is super easy at first, dont mislead yourself! He lets you use the book and all your notes for the test. Dont be a fool, still study!!! Believe me, you'll need to.
Good Teacher overall, don't slack, at the begging his classes appear very easy, but exponentialy increse in dificulty, near the end it's a little overwhelming if you haven't been keeping up.

I think Jack is the best math instructor I have ever had.  He makes things really easy and uses examples that we can understand.  And he tries his best to answer any question, even if it doesn't make sense to ask.  Jack just has a good personality.

Jack is hilarious, smart, and understanding. he's willing to help people to the point that he'll give you answers on your midterms. not an easy class but a fun one because of the combination of psych and jack!
No Comments
